item.title: Xbox Game Pass Adds AAA Game With 86 Metacritic Score
item.description:
Highlights

  • Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition reached Xbox Game Pass on May 2.
  • The game was last available to Microsoft's subscribers in January 2020, although its original Xbox Game Pass stint was console-only.
  • With this release, the entire Tomb Raider Survivor trilogy is now available on Xbox Game Pass.

Xbox Game Pass members can now play Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition as part of their subscription. This is the first title to reach Microsoft's gaming service in May 2024, as well as the 59th new Xbox Game Pass addition since the turn of the year.

While Square Enix's Tomb Raider Survivor trilogy has been fairly consistent at maintaining quality, its first entry is still considered to be the cream of the crop, ratings-wise. Specifically, the 2013 game's Metacritic Metascores range from 86 to 87, depending on the platform, with the Tomb Raider reboot also boasting over 142,000 "Overwhelmingly Positive" user reviews on Steam.

Related
Xbox Game Pass Adds a Funny, Stylish Game With Great Reviews
The last title to reach Xbox Game Pass in April 2024 is a stylish and scintillating game with great reviews and a lot of replay value.

Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition Reaches PC Game Pass For the First Time

Starting May 2, the critically acclaimed title is now once again available on Xbox Game Pass for the first time since January 2020 . Unlike its initial stint on the service, this returning version of Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition is no longer exclusive to consoles, but also available via PC Game Pass. The semi-open-world action adventure is likely to remain on Xbox Game Pass for at least a year, which is how long its previous run lasted.

All New Xbox Game Pass Games in May 2024

🆕Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition

Hauntii

May 23

✅

✅

✅

Much like its name implies, Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition is the content-complete version of the game, which comes with all of its many DLC packs. The add-ons mostly consist of bonus outfits, weapons, and multiplayer characters. The sole exception to that pattern is Tomb of the Lost Adventurer, an extra location that was once only available as a pre-order bonus. The extra tomb can be found in the Coastal Forest region of the map.

Following this release, Microsoft's subscribers now have access to the entire Tomb Raider Survivor trilogy. The critically acclaimed trio was rolled out in stages, beginning with Rise of the Tomb Raider 's Xbox Game Pass debut in December 2023. The final entry in the trilogy, Shadow of the Tomb Raider , reached the subscription service in mid-April.

Xbox Game Pass has already confirmed five more titles for May 2024 , starting with the May 7 release of Parabole's first-person adventure Kona 2: Brume . Open-world cat adventure Little Kitty, Big City is then scheduled to reach the service two days later, followed by Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons on May 14. Around that time is when Microsoft is expected to announce the second wave of its monthly Xbox Game Pass additions. But two of those are already known on account of being previously confirmed day-one releases, with that duo consisting of Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 and Hauntii .

item.title: Genshin Impact Video Leak Shows Clorinde in Dendro Teams
item.description:
Highlights

  • Clorinde, Sigewinne, and Sethos are upcoming characters in Genshin Impact Version 4.7, focusing on Dendro and Electro elements.
  • Clorinde is expected to shine as a main DPS character, especially in team compositions with powerful Dendro supports like Nahida.
  • The unique interaction between Electro and Dendro elements in Genshin Impact creates interesting gameplay possibilities for new team setups.

A new Genshin Impact leak has revealed a video featuring the upcoming five-star character Clorinde in team compositions that rely on using Dendro-related elemental reactions. Clorinde is one of the three characters officially confirmed to be arriving in Version 4.7, which should drop around June 5.

Clorinde will be joined by another five-star character named Sigewinne, who has already made multiple in-game appearances in the ongoing Fontaine storyline. Genshin Impact 's official social media accounts have also confirmed the arrival of a new four-star character named Sethos, who shares the same Electro element as Clorinde.

Related
Genshin Impact Leaks Enemy Lineup for 4.7 Spiral Abyss
A Genshin Impact leak reveals a number of elemental enemies that will be added to the Spiral Abyss mode in the version 4.7 update.

Genshin Impact 's combat system allows players to include up to four different characters in their party and combine their elements to trigger different elemental reactions to maximize their damage potential. A new post on the Genshin Impact Leaks subreddit has revealed how well Clorinde performs when placed in a party that includes powerful Dendro supports such as the Sumeru Archon Nahida. The first team video shows a team composition consisting of two Electro users, Clorinde and Yae Miko, and two Dendro characters, Nahida and Baizhu. The second video also features Clorinde and Nahida, but Yae and Baizhu have been replaced with Fischl and Kazuha.

Genshin Impact Leak Shows Clorinde in Dendro Teams

Clorinde's primary role in most team compositions will be as the main DPS, and she is expected to become one of the best Electro users in Genshin Impact . Players who want to use Clorinde in the team compositions shown in the leak need to have the Dendro Archon Nahida in their party since she's by far the most powerful support who can apply Dendro damage. Unlike most other reactions, Electro and Dendro have a unique interaction since combining them applies an aura called Quicken that lasts for seven seconds.

Using an Electro attack on a target affected by Quicken will trigger Aggravate, which deals additional Electro damage, scaling with the character's Elemental Mastery. Overall, fans don't seem too happy about Clorinde's performance in this team, claiming she could be a better fit for Genshin Impact 's Overload party type .

Clorinde's kit will include the Bond of Life mechanic, just like the recently introduced Pyro Harbinger Arlecchino . This means that players will have to make sure to equip her with the right support crew since one of the Bond of Life's effects is to reduce incoming healing. Considering that the footage was taken from the 4.7 beta, it means that HoYoverse still has time to make additional changes to the way Clorinde's kit works.

item.title: Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Player Recreates Transformers TV Show Intro in the Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players love freedom in Tears of the Kingdom, and one fan even recreated the intro to the Transformers TV show in-game.
  • Gamers enjoy building hoverbikes and using Zonai devices creatively, pushing the limits of gameplay possibilities.
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom offers limitless choices, showcasing the best open-world gameplay experience.

A fan of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom recreated the Transformers intro in-game. The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is popular for its emphasis on freedom in play style. Gamers being able to play the game how they want to extends to fighting enemies, completing quests, and even just how they spend time in the world of Tears of the Kingdom overall.

Some players love devising different ways to traverse the environment in the game, which is why some gamers have figured out how to build the best hoverbike in Tears of The Kingdom . Other players enjoy spending their time figuring out the many silly things they can use Zonai devices for, and this includes recreating TV show intros. Transformers may not be what gamers initially think of for a Legend of Zelda crossover, but it can be achieved with Zonai machines.

Related
Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Player Builds Impressive Motorcycle With Flame Emitters
A creative Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom shares their latest creation, a motorcycle with flame emitters that makes Link roam through Hyrule with class.

Reddit user ReelDeadOne has recreated the 1984 Transformers intro shot-for-shot in The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom . Fan favorites like Starscream and Optimus Prime appear in various forms, like Starscream's flying jet mode. The 33-second final cut of the video required 197 gameplay hours just to collect all the footage, and the dedicated player notes being inspired by other fan creations, such as a popular Godzilla scene recreation in Tears of The Kingdom . There are a multitude of choices gamers can make using Zonai machinery from Tears of the Kingdom , and what can be done is mostly limited by the player's imagination.

The Transformers series has not received much attention in the gaming space recently, and some fans think that releases like Transformers: Fall of Cybertron are among the list of third-person shooters that need Switch ports . Until the series is given more attention, using Zonai devices to recreate the feeling of controlling the giant mechs may be as close as some fans get for some time.

Transformers Intro Remake Showcases a Different Way to Play Tears of The Kingdom

The fact that setting up such impressive scenes to edit together later is possible at all in The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is even surprising to fans who have been playing the game. Some commenters believe that Tears of the Kingdom may be a way to bring attention back to the popular machinima style of video production. The limitless possibilities that Tears of the Kingdom contains are part of why some believe it is one of the best open-world games of all time .

item.title: Helldivers 2 Player Reveals Helpful Strategy That Makes Killing Bile Titans Easier
item.description:
Highlights

  • Learn how to defeat Bile Titans in Helldivers 2 by anticipating their spit attacks and cleverly using powerful Stratagems.
  • Position yourself strategically, time your attacks, and use 500kg Bomb or Orbital Precision Strike to deal massive damage to these tough enemies.
  • Share and discover new tactics with the Helldivers 2 community to take down Bile Titans, adapt to patch changes, and create more effective strategies.

A Helldivers 2 player shared the perfect strategy for defeating the formidable Bile Titans with ease. Helldivers 2 is renowned for its intense cooperative gameplay and challenging enemies and poses significant challenges for players, particularly when facing off against the Bile Titans.

Bile Titans, vicious enemies in the game, have long troubled players due to their resilient nature and devastating attacks. They are considered one of the toughest enemies to beat in the game, and players are always trying to come up with new tactics to beat the Bile Titans in Helldivers 2 . Recently, a savvy player has cracked the code to effectively take down these menacing creatures. By observing the Bile Titans' movement patterns and understanding their attack behaviors, this player has devised a strategic approach to exploit their vulnerabilities.

Related
Helldivers 2's Latest Update Has Made One Enemy More Terrifying
One of Helldivers 2's Terminid bugs appears to have been secretly buffed after the latest update, which was released several days ago.

On a Reddit post, WhiteRaven_M shared that the key to this newfound success lies in anticipating the Bile Titans' spit attacks, which have a predictable range of approximately 20 meters. By strategically positioning themselves and timing their attacks, players can land devastating blows using powerful Stratagems like the 500kg Bomb and Orbital Precision Strike. These are two of the most powerful stratagems in Helldivers 2 .

Beating the Bile Titans With an Eagle 500KG Bomb or the OPS

The player suggests others use this strategy as soon as a Bile Titan crawls out of a breach, which indicates that the spit attack is ready. According to the Reddit post, players should ping a Bile Titan to see the distance, and when it's around 25–30 meters away, they should throw a 500KG Bomb or an OPS on the ground. Then players should walk 22 meters away from the beam and wait as the Bile Titan walks toward the player. When it's 20 meters away, the creature will start doing its spitting animation at the exact same place where the 500KG Bomb/OPS was placed. After the animation has started, it's fine to move because it won't make the Bile Titan walk toward the player, and the strategem placed on the ground will go off and deal massive damage to the creature.

Other players in the community are also constantly looking for clever ways to deal with Helldivers 2 's Bile Titans and the comments section reflects that by offering more strategies and experiences. Players discuss techniques like diving away from 500kg bombs, which surprisingly increases survival rates, and even debate the mechanics of explosive resistance. Most players mention that it's possible to stay closer to the beast when the bomb goes off, because explosion damage is significantly smaller when a player goes prone.

Other players suggest agile movements instead of staying 20 meters away. A lot of them would choose to stay closer to the Bile Titan and dive or crawl on the ground when the bomb goes off. This gives them an opportunity to use other strategems and weapons to deal even more damage. With the balancing changes for strategems and weapons in Helldivers 2 patch 01.000.300 , players are sure to come up with more tactful gameplay attacking strategies in Helldivers 2 .

item.title: Rumor: Classic Call of Duty Character Could Be Black Ops 6 Pre-Order Bonus
item.description:
Highlights

  • Frank Woods, a classic character from the Black Ops series, may become a playable operator in the next game.
  • Black Ops titles explore unique time periods and settings, offering narrative experimentation and zombies gameplay.
  • Fans may see Frank Woods as a pre-order bonus for Black Ops 6, allowing them to control him in multiplayer.

According to the latest rumors, Frank Woods, a classic character from the Call of Duty series, may appear in the next Black Ops title as a playable operator. Frank Woods played major roles throughout the Call of Duty: Black Ops series narratives, and players may get the chance to control him in multiplayer in a future release.

The Call of Duty: Black Ops titles are famous in the franchise for maintaining a sense of narrative experimentation, visiting time periods and settings that aren't as commonly explored in Call of Duty titles. The original Black Ops game visited the 1961 Bay of Pigs invasion, as well as the Vietnam War. Series developer Treyarch also used the Black Ops series to further expand the now-standard Call of Duty Zombies gameplay. Cut content from the Black Ops titles revealed all manner of experiments and other potential gameplay innovations.

Related
Call of Duty Black Ops Gulf War Campaign Details Leak Online
The first details about the single-player campaign of Treyarch's Call of Duty: Black Ops Gulf War leak online, evoking mixed reactions from fans.

Now it looks like the next Call of Duty: Black Ops game may try to capitalize on players' affection for some of the game's recurring characters. According to Call of Duty -focused social media account CharlieIntel, data miners have uncovered hints that Frank Woods, one of the best Call of Duty campaign characters , will appear as a playable operator in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 (or whatever the game's final title turns out to be).

Playable Frank Woods Operator May Appear as Black Ops 6 Pre-Order Bonus

The tweet from CharlieIntel revealed that Frank Woods may be unlocked as a pre-order bonus for Black Ops 6 , but didn't specify which references or files found by data miners indicated the character's status as a pre-order bonus. With Microsoft gearing up to potentially reveal Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 soon, it's likely that the company has already determined what bonuses it intends to use to sweeten the deal for prospective customers.

Woods has many fans thanks to his long history with the series, and he even appeared as a revived Archetype in Black Ops 4 , long after his presumed death of old age. But the passage of time in the Black Ops timeline would ensure that Woods would be too old to take an active combat role in Black Ops 6 , even if it takes place during the 1991 Gulf War as is rumored. Including Woods as a pre-order bonus character for use in multiplayer would be the more logical choice, as they could show "Uncle Frank" off in his prime, rather than as the decrepit old man he ended up as in Black Ops 2.
